content: across the bottom then back up the other side chain 12 or enough to stretch across the neck of your kitty slip_stitch to the other corner of the cape and bind off this affixes the cape to your kitty so it won t fall off weaving in the end you re all done page 6 of 11 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com putting it all together front and side views of finished kitty cat here is how to put your kitty together shown using another kitty as an example all the pieces laid out together page 7 of 11 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com sew the head to the body by lining up the seams in the back sew on each arm just below the neck i make them just a little forward of where a human shoulder would be page 8 of 11 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com sew the legs on between the 4th and 5th row from the center bottom beginning row i do the arms first so i can see where the middle of the body is going to be then start stitching the leg from the center of the body towards the hip page 9 of 11 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com sew the tail to the back of the body with the bottom of the tail at the 5th row from the center bottom the tail should assumedly cover part of the back seam but it doesn t usually work out that way start sewing the inner edge of the ear on the head at the 3rd row from the center then extending outwards page 10 of 11 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com completed body to do the face i use black 4 ply yarn well white in this instance i cut a long piece separate it into 2 strands it gets twisty when you separate it and use that to make a face you can also use embroidery thread or make the face out of felt and sew it on with sewing thread have fun page 11 of 11 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com
